question: i have a huge burn that is blistering, help?
question_content:
it's dark red and blistering.. i went to the doctor and told me to go back after 3 days! she just cleaned it and put a non-stick gauze..

i don't know what degree it is.. 2nd degree or 3rd degree..

answers.answer_content:
You have a second degree burn. Keep the burn dry and apply either a burn ointment or something like neosporin to help it heal, let the blisters drain when they are ready.  Keep it covered to help with pain and avoid infection. You can take tylenol or ibuprofen for pain. I have no clue when folks started thinking Benadryl was for pain, it is an antihistamine used for allergies but, hey, I've seen crazier stuff posted on here.

EMT Paramedic

sounds to me like a second degree burn, you don't want the third.  anyway what she did is correct, keep it clean, wash with soap but do not (Repeating DO NOT) pop the blisters, also do not put any types of creams or ointments on it.  your body will heal itself.
